contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox film | name = The Racket | image = The Racket film poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Lewis Milestone]] | producer = [[Howard Hughes]] | writer = [[Bartlett Cormack]]<br/>[[Tom Miranda]] | starring = [[Thomas Meighan]]<br/>[[Marie Prevost]]<br/>[[Louis Wolheim]] | music = | cinematography = [[Tony Gaudio]] | editing = Eddie Adams | distributor = [[Paramount Pictures]] | country = United States | released = November 1, 1928 | runtime = 84 minutes | language = [[silent film]]<br>[[English language|English]] intertitles | budget = | preceded by = | followed by = }} '''''The Racket''''' ([[1928 in film|1928]]) is an American crime film directed by [[Lewis Milestone]] and starring [[Thomas Meighan]], [[Marie Prevost]], [[Louis Wolheim]], and [[George E. Stone]]. The film was produced by [[Howard Hughes]], written by [[Bartlett Cormack]] and [[Tom Miranda]], and was distributed by [[Paramount Pictures]]. ==Background== Due to the controversial portrayal of a corrupt police force and city government both the film and the play were [[Banned films|banned]] at the time in [[Chicago]].<ref>[http://www.tcm.com/thismonth/article.jsp?cid=85281&mainArticleId=155255 ''The Racket'' at Turner Classic Movies, by Brian Cady]</ref> ==Reception== [[File:The Racket (1928) film poster.jpg|thumb|''The Racket'' poster.]] ''The Racket'' is one of the first films nominated for the [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]] for [[Academy Award for Best Picture|Best Picture]] (then called "Outstanding Picture") in the [[1st Academy Awards|1929 Academy Awards]]. ==Preservation status== Only one copy of the film is known to exist.<ref>[http://www.silentera.com/PSFL/data/R/Racket1928.html ''The Racket'' at silentera.com]</ref> It was long thought lost before being located in Howard Hughes' film collection after his death. A print was shepherded by [[Hart Wegner|Dr. Hart Wegner]] of the [[University of Nevada, Las Vegas]] film department for restoration by [[Jeffrey Masino]], along with another Hughes-produced film, ''[[Two Arabian Knights]]'' ([[1927 in film|1927]]). In 2004 and 2006, [[Turner Classic Movies]] broadcast ''The Racket'', ''Two Arabian Knights'', and ''[[The Mating Call (film)|The Mating Call]]'' (1928), the first showing of any of the three films in decades. ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== *[[List of rediscovered films]] ==External links== * {{imdb title|0019304|The Racket}} {{Lewis Milestone}} {{Howard Hughes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Racket, The}} [[Category:1928 films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:1920s drama films]] [[Category:Black-and-white films]] [[Category:1920s crime films]] [[Category:American silent feature films]] [[Category:Films about organized crime in the United States]] [[Category:Films directed by Lewis Milestone]] {{1920s-drama-film-stub}}
